Name.BusinessNameLine1: RMHC OF WESTERN NEW YORK INC
Name.BusinessNameLine2: AKA RONALD MCDONALD HOUSE OF BUFFALO

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: THE ORGANIZATION IS A "HOME AWAY FROM HOME" BY PROVIDING LODGING AND EMOTIONAL SUPPORT FOR FAMILIES OF CHILDREN RECEIVING MEDICAL TREATMENT. THE ORGANIZATION ALSO SUPPORTS PROGRAMS THAT BENEFIT CHILDREN.
IRS990.MissionDescription: THE ORGANIZATION IS A "HOME AWAY FROM HOME" BY PROVIDING LODGING AND EMOTIONAL SUPPORT FOR FAMILIES OF CHILDREN RECEIVING MEDICAL TREATMENT. THE ORGANIZATION ALSO SUPPORTS PROGRAMS THAT BENEFIT CHILDREN.
IRS990.Description: DESCRIPTION OF PROGRAM SERVICE ONE:RONALD MCDONALD HOUSE CHARITIES OF WESTERN NEW YORK, INC. OWNS AND OPERATES THE RONALD MCDONALD HOUSE OF BUFFALO. THE 15-BEDROOM FACILITY, WHICH OPENED ITS DOORS IN 1983, PROVIDES AFFORDABLE LODGING TO FAMILIES OF SERIOUSLY ILL OR INJURED CHILDREN WHO MUST LEAVE THEIR OWN COMMUNITY TO SEEK MEDICAL CARE FOR THEIR CHILD. THE HOUSE SERVES CHILDREN RECEIVING TREATMENT AT WOMEN'S & CHILDREN'S HOSPITAL OF BUFFALO, ROSWELL PARK CANCER INSTITUTE AND ALL AREA MEDICAL FACILITIES SERVING CHILDREN. IN 2010, MORE THAN 600 RONALD MCDONALD HOUSE FAMILIES CAME FROM 30 COUNTIES IN NEW YORK STATE, 12 STATES AND 4 FOREIGN COUNTRIES. THE AVERAGE LENGTH OF STAY FOR A FAMILY IS 5 DAYS.FAMILIES OF SERIOUSLY ILL OR INJURED CHILDREN AGE 21 AND UNDER ARE ELIGIBLE TO STAY AT THE RONALD MCDONALD HOUSE OF BUFFALO. THEY MUST BE REFERRED BY A PHYSICIAN AND BE UNDERGOING INPATIENT OR OUTPATIENT CARE AT A MEDICAL FACILITY. WE ASK A NOMINAL FEE OF $15 PER NIGHT PER FAMILY, WHICH ONLY PARTLY DEFRAYS OPERATING COSTS. IF A FAMILY CAN NOT PAY THE $15 ROOM FEE AND THERE IS A ROOM AVAILABLE, THEY STAY FOR FREE. THE HOUSE HAS PAID STAFF 24 HOURS A DAY, 365 DAYS A YEAR. THE HOUSE IS AN APPROVED LODGING FACILITY FOR FAMILIES COVERED BY MEDICAID.FUNDS ARE SOLICITED THROUGH THE "HEARTFELT TIMES" NEWSLETTER PRINTED AND DISTRIBUTED THREE TIMES PER YEAR, TWO DIRECT MAIL SOLICITATIONS, AND SPECIAL EVENTS ("HELP WITH ALL YOUR HEART" CAMPAIGN, 5K RUN/WALK, MCHAPPY DAY). IN-KIND DONATIONS OF GOODS AND SERVICES TOTALING $35,605 WERE RECEIVED IN 2010. MAJOR IN-KIND DONATIONS INCLUDE ACCOUNTING SERVICES, WASTE DISPOSAL, SOFT DRINKS, DAILY NEWSPAPERS, SECURITY MONITORING, CARPET CLEANING, DAIRY PRODUCTS, NON-PERISHABLE FOOD ITEMS, CLEANING SUPPLIES, HOUSEHOLD PAPER GOODS, VOLUNTEER HOME COOKED DINNERS SEVERAL DAYS A WEEK, AND TOYS.A CORE GROUP OF 30 WEEKLY VOLUNTEERS AND 24 BOARD OF DIRECTORS HELP TO SUPPORT THE STAFF AND FAMILIES OF THE RONALD MCDONALD HOUSE BY PROVIDING LIGHT HOUSEKEEPING FOR THE 14,000 SQUARE FOOT FACILITY, OFFICE ASSISTANCE, AND GARDENING MAINTENANCE. VOLUNTEERS PROVIDE APPROXIMATELY 5,000 HOURS EACH YEAR, WHICH REDUCES THE NEED TO HIRE ADDITIONAL STAFF TO COMPLETE THE MANY, VARIED TASKS.

Activity2.Description: DESCRIPTION OF PROGRAM SERVICE TWO:RONALD MCDONALD HOUSE CHARITIES' MISSION IS TO LIFT CHILDREN AND FAMILIES TO A BETTER TOMORROW. THE RONALD MCDONALD HOUSE IS THE CORNERSTONE PROGRAM OF R.M.H.C., BUT CAN ONLY ASSIST A LIMITED NUMBER OF FAMILIES AT A TIME. TO MEET THE BROADER MISSION OF THE ORGANIZATION, R.M.H.C. PROVIDES GRANTS TO NOT-FOR-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS THAT IMPROVE THE LIVES OF CHILDREN IN WESTERN NEW YORK AND NORTHWESTERN PENNSYLVANIA. MONEY USED FOR THE GRANT MAKING COMES FROM SPECIAL PROMOTIONS HELD BY LOCAL MCDONALD FRANCHISES AND THE MATCHING GRANT ACCOUNT FUNDED BY THE NATIONAL CHAPTER OF R.M.H.C. IN OAK BROOK, ILLINOIS.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION IS EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAXES UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE, EXCEPT ON NET INCOME DERIVED FROM UNRELATED BUSINESS ACTIVITIES. THE ORGANIZATION DOES NOT HAVE ANY INCOME FROM UNRELATED BUSINESS ACTIVITIES. THE ORGANIZATION BELEIVES THAT IT HAS APPROPRIATE SUPPORT FOR ANY TAX POSITIONS TAKEN, AND AS SUCH, DOES NOT HAVE ANY UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT ARE MATERIAL TO THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.THE ORGANIZATION'S RETURN OF ORGANIZATION EXEMPT FROM INCOME TAX FOR THE YEARS ENDED DECEMBER 31, 2007, 2008 AND 2009 ARE SUBJECT TO EXAMINATION BY THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE, GENERALLY FOR THREE YEARS AFTER THEY WERE FILED.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Part XIII, Line 2d: Other expenses and losses per audited F/S
Part XII, Line 2d: Other revenue amounts included in F/S but not included on form 990
Part V, Line 4: Intended uses of the endowment fund.
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: THE ENDOWMENT WAS ESTABLISHED IN 1993. THE DONOR STIPULATED THAT THE ORIGINAL PRINCIPAL OF $500,000 BE HELD AND INVESTED INDEFINITELY AND INCOME FROM THE FUND BE USED FOR OPERATING EXPENSES OF THE HOUSE.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Grantmaker's Description of How Grants are Used
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: GRANT RECIPIENTS MUST SUBMIT A WRITTEN GRANT EVALUATION AND FOLLOW-UP REPORT WITHIN THIRTY DAYS AFTER THE EARLIEST OF THE PROGRAM OR PROJECT COMPLETION OR ONE YEAR FROM FUNDING.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART X - DETAIL OF NET ASSETS
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: NET ASSETS:UNRESTRICTED.............................................2,551,994TEMPORARILY RESTRICTED:TIME RESTRICTED.............................................16,744FOR OPERATIONS AND CAPITAL IMPROVEMENTS TO HOUSE.............8,778FOR ROOM FEES FOR GUESTS UNABLE TO PAY.......................1,475TOTAL TEMPORARILY RESTRICTED................................26,997PERMANENTLY RESTRICTED:HOUSE OPERATIONS ENDOWMENT.................................500,000TOTAL NET ASSETS.........................................3,078,991

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 19: Other Organization Documents Publicly Available
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: ORGANIZATION MAKES ARTICLES OF INCORPORATION, BYLAWS, AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND TAX RETURNS AVAILABLE ON REQUEST. THE BYLAWS INCLUDE A CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 15b: Compensation Review and Approval Process for Officers and Key Employees
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: COMPENSATION COMMITTEE MEETS ANNUALLY TO REVIEW CURRENT STAFFING AND RELATED COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS. THE COMMITTEE CONSIDERS ECONOMIC CONDITIONS, INFLATION RATES AND EMPLOYEE PERFORMANCE IN DEVELOPING COMPENSATION INCREASES TO BE PROPOSED TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS FOR APPROVAL.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 12c: Explanation of Monitoring and Enforcement of Conflicts
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: ORGANIZATION DISTRIBUTES BOARD MEMBER AGREEMENT ANNUALLY AND REQUIRES WRITTEN ACKNOWLEDGEMENT OF AGREEMENT FROM EACH BOARD MEMBER. THE AGREEMENT STATES THE ORGANIZATION POLICIES WHICH INCLUDE AVOIDANCE AND DISCLOSURE OF CONFLICTS OF INTEREST. EMPLOYEES ALSO ARE REQUIRED TO READ AND SIGN AN EMPLOYEE AGREEMENT THAT STATES THE ORGANIZATION POLICIES.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 11: Form 990 Review Process
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE BOARD RETAINS THE SERVICES OF AN INDEPENDENT CPA FIRM TO PREPARE THE ORGANIZATION'S FORM 990. THE FIRM PROVIDES A COPY OF THE FORM 990 TO EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR TO REVIEW WITH THE ASSISTANT DIRECTOR AND TREASURER OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS BEFORE IT IS FILED WITH THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE. COPIES OF THE FORM 990 ARE PROVIDED TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS BEFORE IT IS FILED.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: Form 990, Part VI, Line 4: Description of Significant Changes to Organizational Documents
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: RMHC AMENDED AND RESTATED THE BYLAWS OF THE ORGANIZATION IN OCTOBER 2010.THE SIGNIFICANT CHANGES WERE COMPRISED OF THE FOLLOWING:1) DELETED REQUIREMENT THAT TWO MEMBERS OF THE BOARD BE VOLUNTEERS THAT WORK IN RONALD MCDONALD HOUSE2) CLARIFIED THAT ANY DIERCTOR COULD COMPLETE THEIR TERM AS A DIRECTOR AFTER THEIR TERM AS AN OFFICER HAS EXPIRED3) EXPANDED EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE TO INCLUDE CHAIRS OF STANDING AND SPECIAL COMMITTEES4) CLARIFIED THAT A QUORUM SHALL BE REQUIRED FOR TRANSACTION OF BUSINESS AND ACTIONS BY THE BOARD5) REVISED STANDING COMMITTEES TO INCLUDE AN EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE, FINANCE COMMITTEE, AND SUCH OTHER COMMITTEES AS THE BOARD MAY ESTABLISH BY RESOLUTION6) UPDATED LANGUAGE ON COMMITTEE DUTIES TO REFLECT THE STANDING COMMITTES, AS REVISED
